channel.title: Help with 317's!
channel.description: um wen ever i try to play a 317 the whole screen closes out wen ever i take to steps wat can i do to prevent this? ty for helping me!

item.title: Help with 317's!
item.dc:creator: @AsianTony4 AsianTony4
item.description:
@AsianTony4 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:345392”][quote author=AsianTony4 link=topic=441771.msg3244797#msg3244797 date=1277257532]
Get a different source.
[/quote][quote author=AsianTony4 link=topic=441771.msg3244918#msg3244918 date=1277270290]

Have you ever thought of posting in the correct section? Do you not have enough brains to figure this out?

Good lord, read the rules.

This is not posted as a client problem. Hes posting in the correct section this could be a coding error inside his run file, which belongs in Server Help. Hence the " the whole screen closes out wen ever i take to steps " could be due to a coding problem in the client.java files.
[/quote]

You sir are a moron. The problem exists in the client. The problem is that with 317’s and 64-bit Java, it’s thought that an innefficient path finding method causes the client to segfault. Whether this is true or not remains to be provent, but this problem only occurs with 317 clients running on 64-bit Java.[/quote]

You sir are a moron. An experienced Moderator moved this thread to the server help section therefore its considered server help.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with 317's!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

AsianTony4:

Get a different source.

Have you ever thought of posting in the correct section? Do you not have enough brains to figure this out?

Good lord, read the rules.
[/quote]

This is not posted as a client problem. Hes posting in the correct section this could be a coding error inside his run file, which belongs in Server Help. Hence the " the whole screen closes out wen ever i take to steps " could be due to a coding problem in the client.java files.[/quote]

You sir are a moron. The problem exists in the client. The problem is that with 317’s and 64-bit Java, it’s thought that an innefficient path finding method causes the client to segfault. Whether this is true or not remains to be provent, but this problem only occurs with 317 clients running on 64-bit Java.

Read full topic
